trans-unit.source: Creates a new image (icon, cursor, or bitmap) and copies the attributes of the specified image to the new one

seg-source.mrk: Creates a new image (icon, cursor, or bitmap) and copies the attributes of the specified image to the new one

target.mrk: Creates a new image (icon, cursor, or bitmap) and copies the attributes of the specified image to the new one

trans-unit.source: Handle to the image to be copied.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the image to be copied.

target.mrk: Handle to the image to be copied.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the type of image to be copied. This parameter can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the type of image to be copied.
This parameter can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: Specifies the type of image to be copied.
This parameter can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the desired width, in pixels, of the image. If this is zero (Default), then the returned image will have the same width as the original $hImage.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the desired width, in pixels, of the image.
If this is zero (Default), then the returned image will have the same width as the original $hImage.

target.mrk: Specifies the desired width, in pixels, of the image.
If this is zero (Default), then the returned image will have the same width as the original $hImage.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the desired height, in pixels, of the image. If this is zero (Default), then the returned image will have the same height as the original $hImage.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the desired height, in pixels, of the image.
If this is zero (Default), then the returned image will have the same height as the original $hImage.

target.mrk: Specifies the desired height, in pixels, of the image.
If this is zero (Default), then the returned image will have the same height as the original $hImage.

trans-unit.source: [optional] This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the newly created image.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the newly created image.

target.mrk: Handle to the newly created image.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the resource, you can release its associated memory by calling _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function respectively for bitmaps, cursors, or icons.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the resource, you can release its associated memory by calling _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function respectively for bitmaps, cursors, or icons.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the resource, you can release its associated memory by calling _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function respectively for bitmaps, cursors, or icons.

trans-unit.source: The system automatically deletes the resource when its process terminates, however, calling the appropriate function saves memory and decreases the size of the process's working set.

seg-source.mrk: The system automatically deletes the resource when its process terminates, however, calling the appropriate function saves memory and decreases the size of the process's working set.

target.mrk: The system automatically deletes the resource when its process terminates, however, calling the appropriate function saves memory and decreases the size of the process's working set.
